description: In her Sept. 20 op-ed column, “The candidates’ Constitution,” Ruth Marcus demonstrated that it is she, not GOP presidential candidate Rick Santorum, who needs a tutorial in constitutional law. In particular, when Ms. Marcus hubristically attempted to belittle and ridicule Mr. Santorum for his “ill-informed” statement that “judicial supremacy is not in the Constitution,” she superciliously sneered: “Um, hello, Marbury v. Madison anyone?” But with this reply, Ms. Marcus revealed her own constitutional sciolism. Because even leaving aside that there is no language or provision anywhere in the Constitution that gives the federal judiciary the authority to invalidate an act of Congress or make a legitimate claim of constitutional supremacy, Marbury v. Madison did not establish the doctrine of judicial supremacy. It established the doctrine of judicial review. Read full article >>
title: Read your Constitution again
